greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(n) = -2*a(n-1) + 4*a(n-2), a(0) = 1, a(1) = 0.
comment: The absolute values are the constant terms of the reduction by x^2->x+1 of the polynomial p(n,x) given for d=sqrt(x+1) by p(n,x)=((x+d)^n-(x-d)^n)/(2d), for n>=1.  The coefficient of x under this reduction is given by A103435.  See A192232 for a discussion of reduction. - _Clark Kimberling_, Jun 29 2011
link: Index entries for linear recurrences with constant coefficients, signature (-2,4).
formula: (-1)^n*a(n) = sum(k=0..n, binomial(n,k)*(F(n+1)-F(n))), F(n) Fibonacci number A000045. - _Peter Luschny_, Oct 01 2014
results.author: _Paul Barry_, Jul 17 2003
